metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3092 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The MultipartStream class in Apache Commons Fileupload before 1.3.2, as used in Apache Tomcat 7.x before 7.0.70, 8.x before 8.0.36, 8.5.x before 8.5.3, and 9.x before 9.0.0.M7 and other products, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via a long boundary string. It was discovered that the Tomcat Fileupload library incorrectly handled certain upload requests. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3092` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet2.4-java - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
libservlet2.5-java - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
libtomcat6-java - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
tomcat6 - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
tomcat6-admin - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
tomcat6-common - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
tomcat6-examples - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
tomcat6-extras - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
tomcat6-user - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.6
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.6
tomcat7 - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.6
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.6
tomcat7-common - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.6
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.6
tomcat7-user - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libcommons-fileupload-java: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
tomcat6 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1+esm1').
tomcat7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.52-1ubuntu0.6').
